deepG 0.2.0
  • Reference

Reference

All functions

calculateStepsPerEpoch()

do one full preprocessing iteration to figure out what the observed steps_per_epoch value is

crispr_full

Example training dataset consiting of a sequence of nucleotides of CRISPR loci Filtered for unambigous characters and contains only characters in the vocabulary A,G,G,T contain all CRISPR loci found in NCBI representative genomes using CRT Can be loaded to workspace via data(crispr_full)

crispr_sample

Example training dataset consiting of a sequence of nucleotides of CRISPR loci Filtered for unambigous characters and contains only characters in the vocabulary A,G,G,T Can be loaded to workspace via data(crispr_sample)

end_gpu_session()

Ends the GPU sesstion

fastaFileGenerator()

custom generator for fasta files, will produce chunks in size of batch.size by iterating over the input files. If the input file is smaller than the batch.size, batch size will be reduced to the maximal size. So the last batch of a file is usually smaller.

getVocabulary()

Returns the vocabulary from character string

messagef()

wrapper for message(sprintf)

parenthesis

Training dataset of synthetic parenthesis language Can be loaded to workspace via data(parenthesis)

predictNextNucleotide()

Predict next nucleotides in sequence output as S4 class

preprocessFasta()

wrapper of the preprocessSemiRedundant() function called on the genomic contents of one fasta file. Multiple entries are combined with newline characters.

preprocessSemiRedundant()

Preprocess string to semi redundant one-hot vector

replaceChar()

Replaces specific nucleotides in a sequence one by one

startGPUSession()

Limit Tensorflow proccess to one or multiple GPUs.

trainNetwork()

Trains a (mostly) LSTM model on genomic data. Designed for developing genome based language models (GenomeNet)
